Wisdom: أَكْبَرُ الْحُمْقِ الْإِغْرَاقُ فِي الْمَدْحِ وَالذَّمِّ
enWisdom: The greatest foolishness is exaggeration in praise and censure

Wisdom: أَحْمَقُ النَّاسِ مَنْ ظَنَّ أَنَّهُ أَعْقَلُ النَّاسِ
enWisdom: The most foolish of all people is the one who thinks that he is the most intelligent of all people
The most foolish of people is the arrogant pauper
The most dim-witted of all fools is the one who boasts with foul language
The greatest foolishness is being conceited in [the state of] poverty

Wisdom: أَحْمَقُ النَّاسِ مَنْ يَمْنَعُ الْبِرَّ وَيَطْلُبُ الشُّكْرَ وَيَفْعَلُ الشَّرَّ وَيَتَوَقَّعُ ثَوَابَ الْخَيْرِ
enWisdom: The most foolish of all people is the one who prevents good deeds and [then] seeks gratitude, and does evil and [then] expects the reward for [doing] good

Wisdom: أَحْمَقُ النَّاسِ مَنْ أَنْكَرَ عَلَى غَيْرِهِ رَذِيلَةً [رَذَائِلَهُ‏] وَهُوَ مُقِيمٌ عَلَيْهَا
enWisdom: The most foolish of all people is the one who censures others for a vice while he [himself] performs it
